list.item: More visiting at the Huffs and the McCarters -

div1.p:
Dearest family - My pen is upstairs & I am too lazy to make a special trip after it - so please excuse this pencil which fortunately for me I found in the table drawers - though unfortunately for you isn't it? It is Sunday night again after a lovely day - warm & sunny for a wonder - though the weather prophets around here predict rain for tomorrow. I was so pleased & surprised to get your long letter Friday - Jane - & thank you for it - the stamps & veil inclusive - Yes I remember Mrs. Guernsey very well! What are the Band & Tillelows propo
is very exciting - saw a picture of one in the Digest. I think & was quite pleased to be able to tell these easterners that we were going to use them! The west is looked down upon somewhat you know - this side of the Mississippi! No have not written Uncle Art yet about going to Wash. have not answered the very nice letter he wrote that I forwarded to you. As to New York well - I have no definite plans for after my D. A. R. ing! and shall wait & see how things work out - have not decided definitely about coming here again. You know - Jane haven't you enough to do without working
about the new house in the block - Is it square & like the others? How is Louise next door? That reminds me - What has become of Louise Nachstheim? I believe I went off without ever saying a word to her didn't I?

Since writing you Wednesday night have put in a busy time - Thursday eve - Abby & I went over to Huff's for dinner & the evening night & had an awfully good time. Mr. H. is cutting timber towards Pigeon
Forge - has a job that will last a couple of years I guess -

Such a storm of rain & wind as sprung up that night! The worst yet with thunder & lightning thrown in early in the morning - It tried to clear Friday but didn't succeed entirely but the debate came off in the evening just the same. Did I tell you the subject. Resolved that fire is more destructive than water. Such a useless thing but Mr. C's choice.

Some of the youngsters in my room & Abbie's have been practicing faithfully every day on a dramatization of "Sleeping Beauty" they did all the planning & drilling themselves & very well have they done too. They gave it
before the debate - I helped them dress - using some of our stuff from previous performances -

Saturday it dribbled snow all day without really stopping once but in such a half hearted way that it was practically all gone this morning - I worked at various things all day - mended & cleaned my wool dresses - darned in the evening - read some of my literature & spent a busy & peaceful day generally - We had planned to walk over to Tom's in the p.m. & stay all night but went instead this a.m. starting about Sunday School time - had a great tramp through muddy roads - climbed a hollow went along a ridge & finally came down through a plowed field & the mud we picked up on our feet! Great cakes! Tom & the girls stay in a little cabin not far from here for school & go home weekends - they are all such nice youngsters - so much to them & so dependable. Polly helped her mother get dinner while Tom & the youngest girl Dessie (about six) entertained us - Cora - Clarissy & Birthana came into the burg for Sunday School - Then we had dinner - beans - cornbread biscuits - fried potatoes - pickled beets - cucumber pickles - cake - pie & coffee!
The whole family never sit down to the table when you visit - the man of the house does usually & the women wait - so Polly & her mother waited. Mr. McC. was away. Mr. Cresswell arrived in the course of time with Dan & the buggy - We started back about four - we girls riding & the two youths walking - having had a very nice time. I have spent the eve. since reading Abby & I refraining from B.Y. - for once! Emily & Evelyn attended.
Well the lamp is going out & it's about 9:40 & bedtime again.

p.del: Wonder what I will have decided two weeks from tonight! I do want to see you all so much but just can't think of visiting around in Tacoma & Seattle somehow - wish you'd consider coming east to see me if I stay.

div1.p: Just loads of love as ever -
